concept.title: Smart Contract Trust Key
concept.shortdesc: The Smart Contract Turst Key (Trust-key for short) is the key explicitly trusted by the smart contract to sign TokenScript.

conbody.p: If a TokenScript generates a transaction to be sent to a smart contract, the smart contract needs to express trust towards the TokenScript's signing key, here to referred as "Trust Key".
This mechanism is important for providing trust.
There are two ways to express trust from the Smart Contract to the TokenScript Key:

section.title: Configure the smart contract to return the fingreprint of the key
section.p: A smart contract with key management feature can return the currently trusted TokenScript key through a 256-bit fingerprint.

section.title: Send an Express-of-Trust transaction
section.p: Presently we restrict the TokenScript key to be using secp256k1 curve to make implementation simple, therefore, it is also a valid Ethereum key. This key does not need to be used on the blockchain at all, and in fact we advise not to use it on the blockchain, since the life cycle of a TokenScript key is different then the life cycle of an Ethereum key. One might discard a TokenScript key and unawaringly lost the Ethers, or spent all the Ether and discard the key only to find later that it has other uses.
